result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on January 24, 2023 at 09:15 am.
NMJ

9:35 AM Defendant Henry Lee Below Jr. appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Henry Lee Below Jr.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense stipulates to identification of Defendant. Officer John Martini sworn in and testified by video. State moves for bind over, Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report

03:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Henry Lee Below Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Henry Lee Below Jr. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $250 Cash Bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim N.J., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No weapons, Maintain absolute sobriety, Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. GPS and may not be within 500 feet of N.J's residence. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
